title: Unable to convert list of numpy-type scalar to Tensor
body_html:
Similar to #3513, I happened to see an error when I wanted to convert list of int to LongTensor. To reproduce,

In [29]: torch.LongTensor([1])
Out[29]: 

 1
[torch.LongTensor of size 1]

In [30]: torch.LongTensor(np.array([np.int32(1)]))
Out[30]: 

 1
[torch.LongTensor of size 1]

In [31]: torch.LongTensor([np.int32(1)])
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-31-54da3b7d43a0> in <module>()
----> 1 torch.LongTensor([np.int32(1)])

RuntimeError: tried to construct a tensor from a int sequence, but found an item of type numpy.int32 at index (0)

Of-course I can fix this by casting numpy.int32 to int, but I wonder if this could be handled in pytorch similar to #3513?

body:
Similar to #3513, I happened to see an error when I wanted to convert list of int to LongTensor. To reproduce, 

```py
In [29]: torch.LongTensor([1])
Out[29]: 

 1
[torch.LongTensor of size 1]

In [30]: torch.LongTensor(np.array([np.int32(1)]))
Out[30]: 

 1
[torch.LongTensor of size 1]

In [31]: torch.LongTensor([np.int32(1)])
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-31-54da3b7d43a0> in <module>()
----> 1 torch.LongTensor([np.int32(1)])

RuntimeError: tried to construct a tensor from a int sequence, but found an item of type numpy.int32 at index (0)
```

Of-course I can fix this by casting numpy.int32 to int, but I wonder if this could be handled in pytorch similar to #3513?
